document.forum_title: Breaking News Updates | Latest News Headlines | Photos - News Videos
document.discussion_title: Sheared hydrant causes watery mess in Valley Glen
document.topic_text: 11:40 Sheared hydrant causes watery mess in Valley Glen A sheared hydrant caused by a solo-vehicle crash created a watery mess in Valley Glen Monday morning. Check out this geyser!! Just arriving on the scene. Woodman and Burbank Blvd. Car slammed into a hydrant. pic.twitter.com/ES8086wP7I— Jovana Lara (@abc7jovana)... Share on Facebook Tweet A sheared hydrant caused by a solo-vehicle crash created a watery mess in Valley Glen Monday morning. Check out this geyser!! Just arriving on the scene. Woodman and Burbank Blvd. Car slammed into a hydrant. pic.twitter.com/ES8086wP7I — Jovana Lara (@abc7jovana) April 25, 2016 The crash was reported in the 13700 block of Burbank Boulevard at about 10:30 a.m., according to the Los Angeles City Fire Department.Fire officials said the geyser was caused by a driver crashing into the hydrant, but no injuries were reported in the incident. UPDATE: Crews work to shut off hydrant in Valley Glen area https://t.co/arrYWTTQSr pic.twitter.com/WK3WvRtIYY — ABC7 Eyewitness News (@ABC7) April 25, 2016 Surrounding streets were temporarily closed as crews were working to shut down the water. Source: abc7 Keywords
